intro: Lunathyrium ebeneostipes, commonly known as the black-stemmed moonflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom at night. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a glossy surface. The plant is adapted to humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth.
